description: Unique surrogate identifier for a warranty coverage record, used for joins and tracking.
Identifier referencing a supporting schedule/proof record tied to this coverage (e.g., maintenance verification); likely a foreign key; confirm with SME.
Reference to the asset maintenance procedure schedule associated with this coverage, defining tasks or intervals relevant to warranty conditions; likely a foreign key; confirm with SME.
Code indicating the kind of warranty (e.g., manufacturer, extended, component-specific); typically links to a lookup of coverage categories and rules.
Calendar date when the warranty coverage ceases based on time criteria.
Meter threshold at which coverage expires (e.g., odometer or hours), compared to the asset’s current reading to determine remaining eligibility.
Application user associated with creating or owning this record; often the login of the responsible user; meaning may vary by deployment; confirm with SME.
Free-text note describing coverage status or calculations, such as days or meter units remaining or exceeded. Often system-generated explanations of expiration conditions.
System timestamp when this record was most recently updated.
Timestamp of the most recent change attributed to a user action; may duplicate the system’s last update time; confirm with SME.
User who originally created the record (login or employee identifier).
Timestamp when the record was initially created.
User who most recently updated the record.
Timestamp of the most recent user-initiated update.
